data.title: Cinnamara College
data.text:
Mohan Chandra Mahanta

(1903-1989)

Mohan Chandra Mahanta Adhyanyan Gobesona Kendra is a Social Science Research Centre established in collaboration with Cinnamara College on 2nd October, 2010. Mohan Chandra Mahanta(1903-1989) was one of the leading freedom fighters of the region, distinguished lawyer and one of the rare multifaceted personalities of Assam. Date of First Public Meeting to established the research centre in collaboration with the College 19-10-2010 Mission of the Research Centre

To develop research on rural and child education.

To inculcate research on Panchayati Raj

To pursue research on rural history, rural-urban socio-economic aspect.

To undertake research on Tea Culture, immigrant and eco-tourism.

To pursue research and minor research project in terms of ethnicity, cultural practices, environment, erosion, livelihoods, history of conflict, languages, social institution, employment, disease, women empowerment and health.

To institute coveted social science National Research award, National Research Award, creative literary award and emerging researcher award is designed to embrace the diversity, to introduce our legendary personalities of the regions to the nation.

To encourage individuality including the emerging and devoted scholars in the field of Social Science of the Country for today and for tomorrow.

To publish research oriented book.

To institute the life Membership of the Centre

Name of the Award Introduction of Dadhi Mahanta National Social Science Research Award in 2014 Donor of the Award Durlav Chandra Mahanta, founder President, Governing Body, Cinnamara College and Senior Retired Advocate, Guwahati High Court.

Dadhi Mahanta

(1914-1987)

Late Dadhi Mahanta was not only a prominent freedom fighter, but also a pioneer for precipitating the growth of progressive ideology in Assam. He was the first General Secretary, Studentsâ€™ Union of J.B College, Jorhat, which got established in 1930 and aptly deemed to be the second largest college of North-East India. After his graduation, Mahanta joined the post- graduate class in the Department of History at Calcutta University in 1941. Fortunately, he had the proud privilege to be a student of late Emeritus Professor Susobhan Chandra Sarkar of the said prestigious University. After the disastrous incident of bombing in Calcutta city by the Japanese in 1942, the Calcutta University remained closed. Mahanta stayed at Calcutta for some time and in 1943, he came back to Assam. While in Assam, he associated himself closely with the organizational strengthening of the progressive work and relentlessly worked for the betterment of the down-trodden classes. He died in a road accident on 31st January in 1987. Name of the Award Introduction of Prof. Prof Bhabnanda Dutta Award, 2019 Donor of the Award Durlav Chandra Mahanta, founder President, Governing Body, Cinnamara College and Senior Retired Advocate, Guwahati High Court(Letter sent on 20-11-2019)

Prof Bhabnanda Dutta

(1918-1959)

Bhabananda Dutta had a great philosophical mind and the same has been revealed in all his writings. Primarily he was a philosopher and secondarily a literary critic of high standard. Being a versatile genius, he touched upon every sphere of human thought---literary, philosophical, religious, ethical, economic and political. Dutta was born in 1918 at Jorhat.After his graduation from Cotton College, he joined in the post graduate class in the Department of Philosophy, Calcutta University.He got a firstclass in his M.A. Examination. Then he proceeded to London for pursuing his doctoral research in the University of London. But he could not finish his research work theredue to his participation in an important seminar held at Prague, capital of Czechoslovakia. It was organized by UNESCO. He came back to India in 1949 and joined Cotton College as a lecturer in the Department of Philosophy. Afterwards he joined as a faculty member in the department of Philosophy, Gauhati University. Unfortunately Dutta died of cancer on the 3rd of August in 1949. Name of the Award Introducation of Harrijan Bandhu, freedom fighter Mama Krishna Nath National Research Sarmah Award Donor of the Award Durlav Chandra Mahanta, founder President, Governing Body, Cinnamara College and Senior Retired Advocate, Guwahati High Court(Letter sent on 20-11-2019)
